channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Reporter Journal: A sunrise trek through wild solitude in New York City
item.description: New York City is home to more than eight million people but NPR's Brian Mann mapped out an urban hike through solitude and parkland wildness.
item.content:encoded:
New York City is home to more than eight million people but NPR's Brian Mann mapped out an urban hike through solitude and parkland wildness.

(Image credit: Brian Mann)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Ireland headed for coalition government, exit poll suggests
item.description: An exit poll in Ireland's parliamentary election released late Friday suggests the three biggest parties have won roughly equal shares and the country is headed for another coalition government.
item.content:encoded:
An exit poll in Ireland's parliamentary election released late Friday suggests the three biggest parties have won roughly equal shares and the country is headed for another coalition government.

(Image credit: Brian Lawless)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In a shock offensive, insurgents breach Aleppo, Syria's largest city
item.description: Insurgents breached Syria's largest city Friday and clashed with government forces for the first time since 2016, in a surprise attack that sent residents fleeing.
item.content:encoded:
Insurgents breached Syria's largest city Friday and clashed with government forces for the first time since 2016, in a surprise attack that sent residents fleeing.

(Image credit: Ghaith Alsayed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau flies to Florida to meet with Trump after tariffs threat
item.description: Trudeau flew to Florida on Friday to have dinner with President-elect Donald Trump at his Mar-a-Lago club after Trump threatened to impose sweeping tariffs on Canadian products.
item.content:encoded:
Trudeau flew to Florida on Friday to have dinner with President-elect Donald Trump at his Mar-a-Lago club after Trump threatened to impose sweeping tariffs on Canadian products.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Banana art eaten, banana art purchase
item.description: Justin Sun uploaded a video of himself eating the $6.2 million absurdist piece conceptualized by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan.
item.content:encoded:
Justin Sun uploaded a video of himself eating the $6.2 million absurdist piece conceptualized by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan.

(Image credit: Peter Parks)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Millions are heading home from the holiday to face snow and an Arctic blast
item.description: Some parts of the country will receive heavy lake-effect snow and others will see rain or dry weather with subfreezing temperatures.
item.content:encoded:
Some parts of the country will receive heavy lake-effect snow and others will see rain or dry weather with subfreezing temperatures.

(Image credit: Robert F. Bukaty)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: A restored Notre Dame cathedral is unveiled days before its official reopening
item.description: Notre Dame Cathedral has been closed to the public since a fire damaged the landmark in April 2019.
item.content:encoded:
Notre Dame Cathedral has been closed to the public since a fire damaged the landmark in April 2019.

(Image credit: Christophe Petit Tesson)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: British lawmakers push forward a divisive bill to legalize assisted dying
item.description: In a historic vote, lawmakers advanced a bill that would grant the option of assisted dying to those in England and Wales with a terminal diagnosis and a life expectancy of six months or less.
item.content:encoded:
In a historic vote, lawmakers advanced a bill that would grant the option of assisted dying to those in England and Wales with a terminal diagnosis and a life expectancy of six months or less.

(Image credit: Dan Kitwood)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: All I want for Christmas is ... help getting this song out of my head
item.description: The Earworm Eraser is a 40-second audio track specifically designed to banish "Jingle Bells," "All I Want For Christmas Is You" and other much-too-catchy seasonal tunes.
item.content:encoded:
and also an earworm for many. Here, she sings at a 2014 holiday concert in New York City.'/>

The Earworm Eraser is a 40-second audio track specifically designed to banish "Jingle Bells," "All I Want For Christmas Is You" and other much-too-catchy seasonal tunes.

(Image credit: Dimitrios Kambouris)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: To help someone going through a crisis, use these 7 words
item.description: Author and TV host Kelly Corrigan has a radical way to support a loved one through a crisis, big or small. Here's her technique to make someone feel like it's safe to open up.
item.content:encoded:
Author and TV host Kelly Corrigan has a radical way to support a loved one through a crisis, big or small. Here's her technique to make someone feel like it's safe to open up.

(Image credit: FilippoBacci/E+)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Muraskin
